name: oslogin_users_sshPublicKeys_patch
description: Updates an SSH public key and returns the profile information. This method supports patch semantics.

name.description: Required. The fingerprint of the public key to update. Public keys are identified by their SHA-256 fingerprint. The fingerprint of the public key is in format `users/{user}/sshPublicKeys/{fingerprint}`.

updateMask.description: Mask to control which fields get updated. Updates all if not present.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

SshPublicKey.description: The SSH public key information associated with a Google account.

expirationTimeUsec.description: An expiration time in microseconds since epoch.

fingerprint.description: Output only. The SHA-256 fingerprint of the SSH public key.

key.description: Public key text in SSH format, defined by RFC4253 section 6.6.

name.description: Output only. The canonical resource name.

$block: The SSH public key information associated with a Google account.

$ul: **expirationTimeUsec**: An expiration time in microseconds since epoch.
**fingerprint**: Output only. The SHA-256 fingerprint of the SSH public key.
**key**: Public key text in SSH format, defined by RFC4253 section 6.6.
